author: The Wall Street Journal
description:
China is a global shipbuilding powerhouse — and it builds most of America’s cargo ships. President Trump and Congress want to change that with the passing of Trump’s big, beautiful bill. If the U.S. went to war with Beijing over Taiwan, it could struggle to resupply troops due to a lack of U.S.-built cargo ships. WSJ’s Stu Woo breaks down two steps the U.S. is taking to reverse this trend.

#China #Trump #Shorts
title: Why the U.S. Military’s Big Problem Is Chinese-Made Cargo Ships

author: The Wall Street Journal
description:
​​Pyro drones are transforming July 4th firework shows by launching pyrotechnics in intricate patterns with millisecond accuracy. These high-tech displays require extensive engineering, choreographed flight plans with 3D animation software and sophisticated GPS systems. But these massive shows aren’t without risks as crashing drones can be a real concern.

WSJ explores the technology behind how the quadcopter fleets are changing aerial displays.

Chapters:
0:00 Explosive-laden quadcopter
0:46 The pyro element
1:49 Choreography and animation 
4:12 GPS geofencing, safety and accidents
7:21 Testing the drones

Tech Behind 
'The Tech Behind' explores the amazing engineering, computing, science and algorithms that power our favorite tech.

#Drone #Fireworks #WSJ
title: Pyro Drone Shows: The Future of July 4th Fireworks? | WSJ Tech Behind
